meanings.definition: The practice of engaging in a pursuit, especially a sport, on an unpaid basis.
meanings.sent1: In the local soccer league, many players show true amateurism by playing for the love of the game.
meanings.sent2: Her amateurism in tennis was evident as she played without any formal training.
meanings.sent3: The amateurism of the young swimmers made the competition more fun and lighthearted.
meanings.sent4: His amateurism in photography was like a fresh breeze in the world of professional artists.
meanings.sent5: The amateurism of the band brought a raw and authentic energy to the music festival.

meanings.definition: Lack of professional skill or expertise.
meanings.sent1: The singer's amateurism was clear when she forgot the lyrics during the performance.
meanings.sent2: His amateurism in cooking led to burnt pancakes and undercooked pasta.
meanings.sent3: Despite his amateurism in painting, he enjoyed creating colorful messes on canvas.
meanings.sent4: The amateurism of the mechanic resulted in more problems with the car than before.
meanings.sent5: Her amateurism in public speaking made her nervous, but she bravely faced the audience.
